answers.answer: Hi,I understand your concern regarding your pregnancy and age. Pregnancy after 40 have both positive and not so positive aspects. Aside from needing extra care during your pregnancy, chances of having pregnancy complications such as gestational diabetes, pre-eclampsia, high blood pressure, placenta previa or placental abruption increase. The odds of chromosomal problems  and even miscarriage also increase during this time and screening tests for genetic conditions, may be indicated.There are many factors to consider such as your medical history, over all health as well as your experience from your earlier pregnancy. It is best that you check with your obstetrician for proper evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I am 43 now, just had a normal pregnancy at age 41 and am pregnant again.  Are my odds greater of having complications or genetic disorders due to my age?
title: Pregnant for 2nd time in my 40s
